An absolute blast in co-op. Chained Together takes simple platforming and turns it into a frantic, hilarious team challenge. Every jump matters, every mistake becomes a story, and completing a climb with friends feels genuinely triumphant.

This is a fun game 8/10. This game is a small climbing game all about "getting to the top". It has interesting areas and cool assets.

Overall----------
PROS
---Graphics are fine.
---This game seems forgiving compared to other "climb up" games I have played
---I like the wing mechanic. (once you collect 10 hidden collectables, you are able to pseudo glide and you gain a powerful way to skip large sections of the map with trampolines)

CONS
---A couple bugs found when playing that force you to restart (Temple yellow tile puzzle can get locked). Also there are a couple wonky hitboxes on some assets.
---No real story, just climb up


Game was good, would recommend for someone looking for a game that can frustrate you or you want to mess around and play with a couple of friends.

Fun co-op game with great gimmick, but very sensitive to ping. If your friends are in different countries it can be very painful, because if there is lag during quick movements it can yank the chain and cause a fall.
Definitely worth the few bucks. Funniest f-ing game I've played in ages. Definitely recommend doing this with your partner or best friends, I've laughed till I cried.  10/10
Wish it were longer and had added content, but its fun. worth the buy!
Great game, tons of laughs, amazing patience practice and relationship test :D
nice game to play with friends , try this game guys . I personally recommend to play and complete it.

‚õìÔ∏è Chained Together: O Simulador Oficial de Testar Limites ‚õìÔ∏è
Voc√™ achou que sabia o que era compromisso? Que amizade era para sempre? HA! O est√∫dio Anegar Games riu da sua ingenuidade e nos deu Chained Together, o Only Up! com o b√¥nus de voc√™ poder arrastar seus amigos para baixo. √â a escalada, onde a √∫nica coisa mais quente que a lava s√£o os √¢nimos no Discord.
A Realidade Nua e Crua
O jogo √© simples: suba. A pegadinha? Voc√™ e at√© outros tr√™s "parceiros" est√£o presos por uma corrente m√≠stica que tem a flexibilidade de um vergalh√£o congelado. Um passo em falso, um escorreg√£o, um "Ai, calma, me puxa!" e POOF, todo mundo volta para o in√≠cio. √â como um cabo de guerra vertical, mas com consequ√™ncias existenciais e gritos que fariam as banshees terem inveja.
A Corrente: Ela √© a verdadeira vil√£. N√£o √© a plataforma que some, n√£o √© o lag (embora o ping alto seja um assassino silencioso), √© a corrente. Ela te puxa, te joga no abismo, te enrola em volta de um pilar e te faz questionar todas as suas escolhas de vida.
O Multiplayer: A experi√™ncia √© descrita por usu√°rios como "definidora de amizade". Sim, define se voc√™ ainda tem amigos ou se, no final, voc√™ quer desinstalar o jogo. √â um gerador de clipes hil√°rios e momentos de pura rage.
A "Terapia": Segundo um usu√°rio da comunidade Steam, jogar isso fez ele perceber que ele e seus amigos "n√£o compartilham apenas correntes, mas tamb√©m a falta de neur√¥nios". Terapia de casal inclusa!
Veredito
Recomendado. Compre para os seus amigos que voc√™ quer ver sofrer um pouquinho, ou se voc√™ quiser testar os limites da paci√™ncia humana. A risada (depois da raiva) faz valer cada centavo. Esse jogo precisa de um replay depois de cada falha para sabermos exatamente de quem foi a culpa. JUMP NOW!!!!

Chained Together ‚Äî Vertical Chaos in Cooperative Platforming

Chained Together challenges players to climb, swing, and leap through perilous environments while being physically chained to friends. Every movement, jump, and swing requires coordination, making teamwork essential if you hope to make it to the top without disaster.

The game shines in its chaotic physics-based co-op gameplay. The chain connecting players isn‚Äôt just cosmetic ‚Äî it dynamically reacts to every movement, forcing you to adapt constantly. One misstep can drag the entire team down, turning even a simple platforming section into a tense and hilarious challenge.

Replayability and variety keep things interesting. Different difficulty modes, including safer options with checkpoints and high-risk challenges, offer a fresh experience each run. While solo mode exists, the game truly comes alive in multiplayer, where communication and timing turn every climb into a shared thrill.

Teamwork is both the reward and the challenge. Coordinating with friends creates unforgettable moments of triumph ‚Äî and chaos. Mistimed jumps, tangled chains, or unexpected physics mishaps can be frustrating, but they also lead to laughter, memorable fails, and stories you‚Äôll tell long after the session ends.

[h3]Final Verdict:[/h3]
Chained Together is a unique, chaotic platformer that balances precision, cooperation, and humor. Its physics-driven co-op makes every climb a tense, entertaining, and memorable experience. Perfect for friends who enjoy a challenge and plenty of laughs along the way.

‚ÄúBound by a chain, reliant on each other ‚Äî every step is a test of teamwork and timing.‚Äù

Overall Rating: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 10/10

Chained Together is a hilariously chaotic co‚Äëop platformer where up to four players are literally linked by a chain. Every jump, swing, and movement requires coordination ‚Äî one misstep can send everyone tumbling. Solo mode is also available, but the game truly shines with friends.

The physics feel satisfying and tense, especially in modes with rising hazards, making success feel genuinely earned. It can be a bit buggy at times, particularly with local multiplayer controls, but the laughs and teamwork moments more than make up for it.

Realistic Score: ~8.5/10 ‚Äî Fun, challenging, and perfect for friends who like to test their coordination (and patience).
Hellish with the wrong people, and with the right people, fun little game to spend a few hours or so on

Chained Together is one of those games that can make you laugh, scream, panic, cry, and threaten your friends ‚Äì all within the first ten minutes, and in the best possible way.

The idea is simple: you‚Äôre physically chained to your teammates, and you all have to climb, jump, and most importantly not die‚Ä¶ because if one person messes up, everyone goes down.
And that‚Äôs where the chaos ‚Äì and the fun ‚Äì truly begins.

Playing with friends is absolutely hilarious.
When someone makes a perfect jump, the whole team celebrates.
When one person slips, everyone suffers, and instant collective panic follows.
If you want to test friendships, patience, and your ability not to scream into your mic, this is the perfect game.

After just a few rounds, you‚Äôll discover that:
- friends you thought were calm can scream like air raid alarms
- one single misstep can send the whole group back to the start
- despite the frustration, you‚Äôll instantly want to try again

Every successful climb feels like a victory, and every fail usually ends in uncontrollable laughter.
Whether you play with close friends or strangers, Chained Together is ideal for anyone who loves challenge, teamwork, and pure chaotic fun.

Summary:
A crazy, nerve-wracking, yet hugely entertaining game that shines the most in group play.
You might regret knowing your teammates for a moment, but one minute later you‚Äôll all be laughing again.

Rating - 9/10‚≠ê
The best way to destroy your nerves and strengthen friendships at the same time.
Arguably the best game co-op multiplayer game on the market.

**Review: Chained Together**

If you think your friendships are unbreakable, **Chained Together** will happily prove you wrong ‚Äî especially at 3 AM, and *especially* if you‚Äôre not sober. This game is a friendship-crushing masterpiece: terrible in all the right ways, brilliant in execution, and unforgettable whether you want it to be or not.

**What Makes It So Terrible (In the Best Way)**
You and up to three friends are literally chained together, and that chain isn‚Äôt just decoration ‚Äî it‚Äôs physics-driven chaos. Every step, jump, mistake, or panic movement affects everyone. One person slips, the team plummets. Someone hesitates, the chain tightens. Someone tries something ‚Äúcreative,‚Äù and suddenly the entire squad is wrapped around a pole like a human pretzel.

The climbing challenge is punishing. The modes range from ‚Äúdifficult‚Äù to ‚Äúwhy are we doing this,‚Äù with the lava mode adding a constant race against rising death. It‚Äôs mean, it‚Äôs relentless, and it‚Äôs hilariously unforgiving.

**Why It‚Äôs Brilliant**
For all the rage it inspires, the game nails its core idea with surprising elegance. There‚Äôs nothing to distract you: no complicated systems, no bloated menus, no filler ‚Äî just you, your friends, a chain, and a mountain that does not care about your feelings. When you finally coordinate a perfect sequence of jumps or swings, the shared triumph feels incredible.

The physics, while occasionally unpredictable, create moments of pure, chaotic comedy. The ‚ÄúWings‚Äù power-ups offer just enough hope to keep you trying again after you fall‚Ä¶ again.

And despite being simple, the game has resonated with players everywhere. It exploded in popularity for good reason: few games capture both camaraderie and catastrophe as well as this one.

**The Dark Side**

* The physics can be *wonky* ‚Äî hilariously so at times, maddeningly so at others.
* Communication is absolutely essential; without it, expect emotional collapse.
* Input quirks and controller issues can appear in local play.
* Content is limited, and replay value depends entirely on how much joy you find in shared suffering.
* And yes, it can ‚Äî and will ‚Äî strain your relationships.

**The Midnight, Drunk-Friendship Test**
My own experience? Four not-quite-sober friends at 3 in the morning, yelling, laughing, falling, and arguing about who ruined ‚Äúthe perfect run.‚Äù By the end, we were exhausted, proud, and unsure if we were still on speaking terms. If that‚Äôs not the sign of a memorable co-op game, I don‚Äôt know what is.

**Final Verdict**
**Chained Together** is a must-have for anyone brave enough to test their friendships through shared frustration. It‚Äôs the worst fun you can have with people you care about ‚Äî which somehow makes it some of the best.

Buy it. Support these absolute madmen of game design. Encourage them to create something even worse.

Chained Together is a lot of fun, mainly because of its brutally hard difficulty. It‚Äôs definitely not the most perfectly designed game out there, and you‚Äôll notice that in some areas ‚Äî but honestly, for the small price, it‚Äôs absolutely worth it.

The challenge keeps you hooked, the idea is unique, and it gave me several really fun evenings with friends. If you enjoy tough platforming and don‚Äôt mind failing a lot, this game delivers exactly what it promises.
It‚Äôs a good game, but when you finish it, you might feel super angry, like you want to smash your computer or just kill your best friend!!! (fine game)

Great game! I had a blast playing with friends. The challenges were difficult but never felt impossible. The game has some very good faith and philosophical thoughts presented throughout the experience. Regardless if that is your thing or not, the game play is still very fun, challenging, and doesn't overstay its welcome. The game is short and with the right partner, one can get through it in about 2 to 3 hours. Definitely worth playing a second time around at least once more with perhaps a larger group or different friend. Unfortunately the game is the same every time you play. I wish there was a random generated game mode to mix things up or some sort of new game modes, but for $5 the game is perfect.

Played this with a friend thinking it‚Äôd be a chill co-op game... I was wrong. üò≠

This game will test your patience, coordination, and the strength of your friendship. One wrong jump and you both go tumbling down ‚Äî but somehow, it‚Äôs hilarious every single time. The physics are chaotic in the best way, the level design is surprisingly creative, and that feeling of finally reaching a checkpoint after 100 fails is pure serotonin.

It‚Äôs frustrating, funny, and super rewarding once you start getting the hang of it. Honestly, it‚Äôs one of those ‚Äúrage but laugh‚Äù games that you can‚Äôt stop playing.

Grab a friend and prepare to yell, laugh, and fall... a lot.

Chained Together is a really fun game. It‚Äôs challenging and interesting. I‚Äôve completed all the levels, and there‚Äôs just one achievement left, but it‚Äôs almost impossible to get.

The game is definitely worth it ‚Äî it‚Äôs fun, competitive, and tough, all at the same time, which makes for an amazing experience. It‚Äôs best played with friends; random lobbies aren‚Äôt as enjoyable since many players stay AFK, some don‚Äôt speak English, and others are just too inexperienced. But playing together with friends makes it absolutely fantastic. Highly recommended!
